titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lindseth Collection of Alice Ephemera MSS.368
titlestmt.author: Collection processed by Marissa Hiller, with Charlie Morgan, 2015. Sophie Glidden-Lyon, 2016.
titlestmt.sponsor: Processing made possible with the generous support of the Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.langmaterial: Materials primarily in English, with material in Japanese, French, and Czech.
did.unittitle: Lindseth Collection of Alice in Wonderland Ephemera

physdesc.extent: in 27 record cartons, 18 manuscript boxes, 31 flat boxes, 3 shared oversize boxes, 6 oversize folders, 1 rolled storage tube, 1 box binder, and 3 unhoused art objects.

did.abstract: The Lindseth Collection of Alice in Wonderland Ephemera comprises toys, auction catalogs, games, housewares, dolls, posters, books, vinyl sound discs and art relating to Alice in Wonderland collected by Dr. Lall Montgomery. This collection documents Alice in Wonderland in American popular culture.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Lindseth Collection of Alice in Wonderland Ephemera is organized by series and then by object. When applicable, certain items have the following information: Title, Description and Dimension.
Oversized items are located at the end of the finding aid.
Researchers should be aware that there is some overlap between contents of the series. Some material, such as clippings and calendars, can be found in multiple series of the collection.
The Collection is arranged into 9 Series:

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The bulk of the material was acquired by Dr. Lall Montgomery.

Dr. Lall G. Montgomery was born in Deloraine, Manitoba in July 1902. He took his premedical work at the University of Manitoba and graduated in Medicine from the Manitoba Medical College in 1929. After graduation he spent two years in the study of tuberculosis in the Manitoba Sanatorium at Ninette, Manitoba, and then spent three years as a Fellow in Pathology in the Mayo Foundation of the University of Minnesota at the May Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota. After completing this Fellowship, he became director of the Department of Pathology and the Pathology Laboratories of the Ball Memorial Hospital, in Muncie, Indiana where he became Senior Pathologist in the Pathology Department. Dr. Lall G. Montgomery was a Founding Fellow of the College of American Pathologists, and Delegate from the Section on Pathology and Physiology to American Medical Association, President of the American Society of Clinical Pathologists, an Associate Editor of the Journal of the Indiana State Medical Association, and was a member of the Advisory Board of Medical Specialties, representing the Federation of State Medical Boards of the United States.
The Lall G. Montgomery Papers (1929-1970) are housed at Alexander M. Bracken Library, at Ball State University in Muncie Indiana.

In an article published in the January 1965 magazine Doll Collector, Dr. Montgomery says: "It may be difficult to imagine how collecting dolls may have occurred to a collector of translations, but again this will not seems as surprising to a collector as to the non-initiated; in fact this is the usual way in which any collection will branch out into many diverse fields of interest and into many seemingly unrelated ways and by-ways, such as in my case, specially illustrated editions, special biding, parodies, games, pictures, cutouts, sheet music and phonographic recordings, to mention just a few and of course, dolls."
Legal title, copyright, and literary rights reside with Archives and Special Collections, Ball State University Libraries, Muncie, IN.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lindseth Collection of Alice in Wonderland Ephemera comprises toys, auction catalogs, games, housewares, dolls, posters, books, vinyl sound discs and art relating to Alice in Wonderland. Dr. Lall G. Montgomery's collection represents the wide variety of different ways Alice in Wonderland and Alice Through the Looking Glass have been interpreted in American popular culture.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Lindseth Collection of Alice in Wonderland Ephemera; MSS 368; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at Fales Library and Special Collections
relatedmaterial.p: The Alfred C. Berol Collection of Lewis Carroll, MSS.057

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing decisions made prior to 2021 were not recorded. In April 2021, conservators and archivists rehoused selected boxes in the collection in preparation for off-site storage. Items were housed in boxes by material composition rather than series arrangement.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Della Thomas collection (1913-2004) housed at the Edmon Low Library at Oklahoma State University
G. Edward Cassady, M.D. and Margaret Elizabeth Cassady, R.N. Lewis Carroll collection of ephemera, housed at the USC Libraries at the University of Southern California

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and are unavailable to researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Jon Lindseth, 2015. The accession number associated with this gift is 2017.191.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Items in accession number 2017.191 were loaned by Jon Lindseth to the Grolier Club for an exhibit in fall 2015. The materials were then transferred to NYU in November 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains exhibit cards from the Grolier Club's 2015 exhibit Alice in a World of Wonderlands: The Translations of Lewis Carroll's Masterpiece. The cards accompanied items donated by Jon Lindseth in 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contents include reproductions of: A photograph of Charles Lutwidge Dodgson as a young man, a picture-puzzle letter sent to a child-friend, around 1870, a Looking-Glass letter sent by Lewis Carroll to a child-friend in 1893, A photograph of Alice Liddell taken by Lewis Carroll, pages from the manuscript of Alice's Adventures Underground, the original version of Alice in Wonderland, copied out as a gift for Alice Liddell, preliminary sketches by Lewis Carroll for Alice's Adventure's Underground, the Alice Wheel, a picture wheel for you to make up illustrating versions and aspects of Alice and the Wonderland characters, a letter from Carroll to a friendly critic, 1892, concerning his tastes and attitudes, a proof rubbing from the block of one of Tenniel's illustrations with corrections by the artist, the Wonderland Postage-Stamp Case, a facsimile model of the postage-stamp case invented by Lewis Carroll in 1889, and more Lewis Carroll, an anthology of some of Lewis Carroll's less familiar verses and entertainments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contents include reproductions of: A photograph of Charles Lutwidge Dodgson as a young man, a picture-puzzle letter sent to a child-friend, around 1870, a Looking-Glass letter sent by Lewis Carroll to a child-friend in 1893, A photograph of Alice Liddell taken by Lewis Carroll, pages from the manuscript of Alice's Adventures Underground, the original version of Alice in Wonderland, copied out as a gift for Alice Liddell, preliminary sketches by Lewis Carroll for Alice's Adventure's Underground, the Alice Wheel, a picture wheel for you to make up illustrating versions and aspects of Alice and the Wonderland characters, a letter from Carroll to a friendly critic, 1892, concerning his tastes and attitudes, a proof rubbing from the block of one of Tenniel's illustrations with corrections by the artist, the Wonderland Postage-Stamp Case, a facsimile model of the postage-stamp case invented by Lewis Carroll in 1889, and more Lewis Carroll, an anthology of some of Lewis Carroll's less familiar verses and entertainments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 10 stamps from Republic of Maldives. Each stamp shows a different scene from Walt Disney's production of Alice in Wonderland. They are of various denominations; 1 each 1L, 2L, 3L, 4L 5L, 10L, 15L, 2.5R and 5R.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Set of Alice stamps, bought on subscription from Gerald M. King, self styled "Postmaster General /Wonderland"; including several SAE with Wonderland stamps and a letter of thanks/explanation. Stamps detail 18651965. With letter to Dr. Montgomery of Ball Memorial Hospital, Muncie IN who had subscribed to receive them.

did.unittitle: Photos of Dartmouth Winter Carnival Snow Sculpture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: T15 photographs of Alice in Wonderland snow/ice sculptures from the Dartmouth Winter Carnival, 1973. Titles include: Trucking with Alice, Toadledum and Toadledee, White Rabbit, Humpty Dumpty, Mad Hatter, Caterpillar and Toadstools, Walrus, King of Hearts, Cheshire Cat, Through a Frosted Looking Glass, Caterpillar and Toadstools, Cheshire Cat, Humpty Dumpty, Mad Hatter and Mad Hatter's Party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Magazine has an article by Dr. Lall Montgomery "From Translating Lewis Carroll's Alice in Wonderland to Doll Collecting -- And How it Came About" describing his interests and origins in collecting Alice in Wonderland ephemera.

scopecontent.p: Description: "Hand painted Alice in Wonderland tea time dishes." 22 pieces, original printed box). Alice vignettes cast in relief, floral decorations painted by hand. did.unittitle: Advertisement from Dairy-Deli Wonderland of Values Sweepstakes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice in Wonderland Magazine Advertisements

Description: Includes the Original Alice, 7 full-page individual advertisements printed in the Field Magazine over a period of several months in 1949. The artists are identified only as Hanna (5 ads) and Gilroy (2 ads) All of the ads, continue the clever Guinness Alice parodies. And "Oh Mother! Cried Alice. Here's the new Philco fridge" advertisement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1. Cheshire Cat Print. 2. Alice in Wonderland House Print. 3. Wonderland Print by John Anthony Miller. 4. Lewis Carroll Print. 5. Lewis Carroll Print.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description: 1. Alice Pleasance Liddell. A calligraphic rendering of the Carroll poem the End Looking-Glass. 2. Lewis Carroll's Jabberwocky, a Zalben poster issued by Warne to publicize the book. 3. Scribner's American Painter's Series, No. 3, Down the Rabbit Hole by Saul Schary. 4. The Cheshire Cat.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description: 1. Sepia print of Charles Lewis Dodgson. 2. How Doth the Little Crocodile, by Sarah Chamberlain. Calligraphic reproduction with white ink on black background of Alice's recitation in the pool of tears. 3. Psychedelic Caterpillar smoking his hookah, by Jonathan. 4. Alice au Pays des Merveilles, Disney Studios, RKO Films. 4-color poster advertising the exhibition of the Disney film in France.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description: 1. Alice. 2. Life Magazine Poster board Print of Humpty Dumpty. 3. Yellow Lewis Carroll Exhibition Poster. 4. Fantasy, an Alice in Wonderland Artist's Proof by John A. Miller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description: 1. Beyond the Looking Glass of the Patty Hurst Trial by Ralph Steadman, 4 page proof for Rolling Stone Magazine. 2. Alice in Wonderland. 3. Pig n' Pepper by Juan Ripley. 4. Bill Osco's Alice in Wonderland, an X-Rated Musical Comedy. 5. Pool of Tears by Juan Ripley. 6. Croquet Ground by Juan Ripley. 7. Alice and the Caterpillar by Juan Ripley. 8. Pig n' Pepper by Juan Ripley. 9. Alice in Wonderland by Beck Gaurue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Description: 1. Alice in Wonderland Poster. 2. Alice in Wonderland Poster. 3. Production of Alice in Wonderland at the "Teatr Rozmaitosci W.Warszawie". 4. Cheshire Cat Poster "We Are All Mad." 5. 3 Posters with sketches of Alice in Wonderland Characters. 6. Alice's Tea Party Poster. 7. 4 Posters with Alice in Wonderland Scenes. 8.Cheshire Cat Poster "We Are All Mad".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 1/26

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 2/26

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 3/26

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 4/26

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 5/26

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 6/26

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 7/26
Description: Alice sat nodding sleepily on a mossy bank beside her big sister, who was reading.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 8/26
Description: Crocodile: Danger from pirates, or robbers, or deceitful creditors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 9/26
Description: Looking-Glass: Mirror; for a girl - she is jilted at the church door.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 10/26
Description: Wood: If you dream that you are walking along in an extensive wood, it denotes that you will quickly fall in love and also that you will be often married.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 11/26
Description: Caterpillar: You will soon witness some marvelous spiritual phenomena.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 12/26
Description: Nest: bird's nest; for a young woman, this dream foretells a change of abode.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 13/26
Description: Frog: Neglect, lack of interest in your work, slovenliness in dress and in manner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 14/26
Description: Whistling: Gives prediction of a sensational fire, or storm within a week from now.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 15/26
Description: Baby: To dream you had to take a baby, is a hint to fulfill the dream at your earliest possible convenience.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 16/26
Description: Treacle: Beware of excessive heat.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 17/26
Description: Tea: To sip or drink tea, gives promise that you will yet secure the secret of long life, that you may live one hundred years or more.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 18/26
Description: Procession: You shall be the gainer or guardian of property; you shall be the parent of a son who will be an illustrious warrior. He will cause pain, but will be a mighty noble.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 19/26
Description: Club: To dream of a club, denotes short imprisonment which will bring you no disgrace. You will only save money.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 20/26
Description: Game: To dream of playing ball denotes you will be seized for gambling.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 21/26
Description: Reading: To dream of reading, denotes a pleasure trip on which you will get secret information about a plan which will yield you prosperity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 21/26
Description: Shoes: Practical jokes and unwise, harsh criticism alienate your dearest friends from you.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Title: Alice Among the Fortune Tellers 22/26

Description: Inkstand: Avoid Hot drinks; otherwise, you will be troubled with debility or weakness, loss of appetite, indigestion and many other diseases arising from a deranged condition of the stomach.
